headline: Honeywell Q4 Beat And Aerospace Spin Off Reshape Valuation Story
summary: Honeywell International (NasdaqGS:HON) reported a fourth quarter with record orders and backlog. The company highlighted strong organic growth in the period, alongside this record backlog. Honeywell accelerated its planned spin off of the aerospace segment, now targeting completion in Q3 2026. New leadership was announced for the future standalone aerospace business. Honeywell is a diversified industrial and technology company, with aerospace as one of its core segments. The aerospace unit...

headline: Air Scrubber Market Analysis Report 2026 - Global Size, Trends, Competitive Landscape, Opportunities, and Forecasts, 2021-2025 & 2025-2031
summary: The Global Air Scrubber Market is expanding due to stricter environmental regulations and a focus on health standards, driving demand for air purification systems. Challenges include high costs deterring SME adoption. Trends like IoT integration and energy efficiency enhance market appeal, while major players like Honeywell and Daikin innovate. headline: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Gold Swings
summary: Gold prices went haywire. A 9.4 percentage point swing in gold futures prices between the intraday high and low was the largest range since April 2013, according to Dow Jones Market Data. Futures settled slightly up on the day, at a new record high.

raw.headline: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Gold Swings
raw.summary: Gold prices went haywire. A 9.4 percentage point swing in gold futures prices between the intraday high and low was the largest range since April 2013, according to Dow Jones Market Data. Futures settled slightly up on the day, at a new record high.

headline: HON Q4 Deep Dive: Portfolio Simplification, Automation Momentum, and Margin Management
summary: Industrial conglomerate Honeywell (NASDAQ:HON) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, but sales rose 6.4% year on year to $9.76 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $39.3 billion at the midpoint came in 0.7% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.59 per share was 2.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
